results.title: Genetic insights into the effect of Metformin on psychiatry disorders.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: From a genetic perspective, this study finds that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ may reduce the risk of NEU and BID while increasing the risk of @<m>DISEASE_Attention_Deficit_Disorder_with_Hyperactivity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001289 @@@ADHD@@@ and INS.

citations.NLM: Zhou Q, Du Z, Lu R, Shen Y, Jiang Y, Zhu H. Genetic insights into the effect of Metformin on psychiatry disorders. Eur Arch Psychiatry Clin Neurosci. 2025 Aug;275(5):1465-1476. PMID: 40531218
citations.BibTeX: @article{40531218, title={Genetic insights into the effect of Metformin on psychiatry disorders.}, author={Zhou Q and Du Z and Lu R and Shen Y and Jiang Y and Zhu H}, journal={Eur Arch Psychiatry Clin Neurosci}, volume={275}, number={5}, pages={1465-1476}}

results.title: Metformin modulates microbiota-derived inosine and ameliorates methamphetamine-induced anxiety and depression-like withdrawal symptoms in mice.
results.text_hl: ...BACKGROUND: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ exhibits therapeutic potential in @<m>DISEASE_Attention_Deficit_Disorder_with_Hyperactivity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001289 @@@behavioural deficits@@@ induced by @CHEMICAL_Methamphetamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008694 @@@methamphetamine@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Methamphetamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008694 @@@METH@@@) in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Yang J, Zhang Z, Xie Z, Bai L, Xiong P, Chen F, Zhu T, Peng Q, Wu H, Zhou Y, Ma Y, Zhang Y, Chen M, Gao J, Tian W, Shi K, Du Y, Duan Y, Wang H, Xu Y, Kuang YQ, Zhu M, Yu J, Wang K. Metformin modulates microbiota-derived inosine and ameliorates methamphetamine-induced anxiety and depression-like withdrawal symptoms in mice. Biomed Pharmacother. 2022 May;149():112837.
